group.name: Beyond Planet Earth Video Contest
group.description:
1st Place Winners:
Same Same But Different by Mattias Burling
Beyond Planet Earth by Luke Cahill

Runner Up:
Beyond Planet Earth: Mirrored by Rafael Bonilla Jr.


Watch Museum astrophysicist and Beyond Planet Earth Curator Michael Shara explain his vision for the future: http://vimeo.com/29983176

Beyond Planet Earth: The Future of Space Exploration,         a new exhibition opening at the American Museum of Natural History on November 19,         transports visitors to the Moon,         Mars,         and beyond as it boldly predicts humanity’s next steps in space.
Find out more at http://amnh.org/contest


CONTEST INSTRUCTIONS
Each video must begin with the contest slide,         available here:
http://www.amnh.org/contest/amnh_vimeo_slide.png

DEADLINE EXTENDED!

Submit your video by 11:59 pm ET on November 17,         2011.

CONTEST JUDGES
Michael Shara,         curator of Beyond Planet Earth
Hélène Alonso,         Director of Exhibit Interactives and Media,         AMNH
Ruth Cohen,         Director of the Center for Lifelong Learning,         AMNH
Jesus Diaz,         Gizmodo
Blake Whitman,         Vimeo

CONTEST PRIZES
- The winning video will be featured on amnh.org and shown at SpaceFest! at the American Museum of Natural History on January 15,         2012

Winners will also receive:
- Four tickets to Beyond Planet Earth: The Future of Space Exploration at the American Museum of Natural History
- A $100 gift certificate to the Beyond Planet Earth shop
- A year-long Vimeo Plus membership

group.name: OFFICIAL Carl Zeiss Lenses Group
group.description:
Welcome to the Official Carl Zeiss Lenses Group!  
This group is for photographers and cinematographers who are interested in,         or already working with,         Carl Zeiss lenses. We invite you to share your videos shot on any ZEISS lenses as well as your experiences with our products.  

To provide better orientation for other users,         please add the following tags to describe the lenses you used in creating your video:

“Master Prime” 
“Master Zoom” 
“Master Macro” 
“Lightweight Zoom” 
“Ultra Prime”
“Compact Prime”
“Ultra 16”
“DigiPrime”
“DigiZoom”
“SLR” for SLR lenses 
(Distagon,         Planar,         Makro-Planar,         etc.)
“Nokia”
“Sony” 
“Contax”
For any other Carl Zeiss lenses,         please use the general tag “Carl Zeiss”.

group.name: 24 HOURS OF REALITY
group.description:
24 Hours of Reality is a group created by the Climate Reality Project for filmmakers to make and post videos on Global Climate Change. How is climate change affecting your life; where you live; people you know?  Climate Change is manmade and happening right now.  Tell us your story in under 3 minutes.

Any person appearing in your video needs to sign an appearance release.  Here is a link to our appearance release

http://forms.climaterealityproject.org/Avrelease

Please email your signed forms to 24hoursofreality@gmail.com when you post your video.

group.name: Vimeo SXSW!
group.description: Upload all of your SXSW experiences here and join Vimeo for a series of great events throughout Interactive and Film. We'll be hosting screenings,         a panel and throwing a mind-bending party with Nikon in the once-dormant Seaholm power plant. Hope to see you and your camera down there!

group.name: PROJECTiON
group.description:
Culture Shock and Vimeo are proud to present PROJECTiON,         a curated series of contemporary moving image digital artworks selected from Vimeo.com which were screened at VOLTA NY from March 3-6,         2011. 

Bleeding-edge moving image works exhibited in fine art contexts.  10 films by: Scott Pagano - Arev Manoukian – Zeitguised - Kirsten Lepore - Masaki Yokochi - Mike Winkelmann - Hugh McGrory - Glenn Marshall - Rob Seward - J.G. Zimmerman. 

‘Digital’ or ‘New Media’ art (Computer graphics,         Computer animation,         the Internet,         Interactive technologies,         Generative art,         Information art,         Video art,         Robotics and Bio technologies) is often defined through its opposition to ‘Old Media’ art (traditional painting,         sculpture etc).

The PROJECTiON initiative views and presents work that has undergone computer/human interaction processes in direct lineage to its cultural predecessors,         showing that an expanded digital toolset can lead to an expansion of formal concerns and impulses that can be traced back throughout the canon of art history.

http://www.cultureshockmarketing.com/category/projection/

group.name: Vimeo Vidblogs
group.description:
Blogging through video. Thoughtfully constructed scenes from our lives. These are the memory makers.

Learn more about the art of the vidblog here http://vimeo.com/videoschool/lesson/5/art-of-the-vidblog

group.name: VIMAPPINGEO
group.description:
VIMAPPINGEO is a small community inside Vimeo where you will be able to find the last works related with projection mapping.

We will be posting new upcoming events on the calendar,         keep an eye on it and you won't have to write "I wish I was there...or,         I would love to see it life" The aim of this community keep people posted about what is going on about projection mapping.

Also on the forum we will be posting making off,         interviews,         works breakdowns and many more.

Welcome and enjoy VIMAPPINGEO.

group.name: Vimeo Festival

group.name: We Work in TV
group.description:
a place for vimeo users who works in television to share completed,         professional projects.  freelance or staff,         producer,         editor,         designer or director -- whatever your role,         if you are a creative professional in broadcast or cable,         local or national,         your work is welcome here.  

of course,         contributions to this group must be in accordance with vimeo's community guidelines.  please read them here if you are unfamiliar: http://vimeo.com/guidelines

please help us grow by inviting your colleagues to join and participate.

group.name: Vimeo Festival + Awards Community Screening
group.description:
Hey Vimeans! We wish everyone could come to the Vimeo Festival and Awards on Oct 8 and 9,         but sadly that isn't possible. One of the most important parts of Vimeo is the community. Dan and I are in charge of running the Community Tent where tons of Vimeans are going to meet up,         hang out,         and watch YOUR VIDEOS. 

Submit your personal best video,         or make one specifically for the screening. We'll show your video in the Community Tent during the Festival!

group.name: Cinema Out of Your Backpack
group.description:
www.cinemaoutofyourbackpack.com

The Cinema Out of Your Backpack Festival is dedicated to a new generation of filmmakers. Their home: the internet. Their set: the world. Their tools: DSLR video cameras. Everything they need fits in a backpack. They can shoot wherever and whenever they want. And they have stories to tell. Lots of. We believe this is the future of independent cinema - extremely inexpensive films that you can make by yourself.

SCREENING & AWARDS SHOW
The first annual Awards Show will be held on November 9,         2011 at the Caligari Cinema on campus of the Baden-Wuerttemberg Film Academy (Ludwigsburg,         Germany). 

Your host for the evening: Roland Sigmond,         a genius lost in Transmedia and the creative consultant for Cinema Out of Your Backpack. 

33 filmmakers from 10 different countries have entered the best scene from their feature film idea. A shortlist of 12 Fiction and 5 Documentary entries has been voted by the online community. Based on this shortlist,         the judges have picked an Official Selection of 10 scenes which will be part of the Screening and Awards Show. The Official Selection will be fully revealed by the end of October. 

SCHEDULE
6PM - 9PM: Screening and Awards
9PM - 1AM: After Show Party

All dates are Central European Time (UTC+1).

LOCATION
Caligari Cinema
c/o BW Film Academy
Akademiehof 10
71638 Ludwigsburg
Germany

ATTENDING?
If you want to attend the event please send an email with your full name to rsvp@cinemaoutofyourbackpack.com. Free entrance.

Stay tuned for special guests and more.

group.description:

If you looking for awesome tools to use with your camera,         check out www.cinevate.com

group.name: 01SHORTFILM___the group
group.description:
This group is dedicated to all those filmmakers that,         abiding by or challenging traditional CINEMATIC conventions,         strive to tell compelling and,         needless to say,         beautiful stories.

Feel free to directly add the videos that suit this description. If they don't,         they'll be removed by the moderators.
::::::::::::::::::::
IMPORTANT NOTICE: REFRAIN FROM VIDEOSPAMMING PLEASE

This group is NOT meant for tests,         reviews,         time lapses,         vacation videos,         skate videos,         music videos,         trailers,         showreels,         it is meant exclusively for complete fiction short films.

If you violate these rules or if you repeatedly remove and add the same video to the group,         your video will be removed without notice. If you insist,         you will be removed from the group. If you insist,         you'll be signalled to the vimeo staff,         which will decide whether to delete your vimeo account.
:::::::::::::::::::::
More quality groups/channels:

vimeo.com/shortfilm01 (fiction films)
vimeo.com/channels/01shortfilmX (Experimental films)
vimeo.com/groups/videodrome
vimeo.com/groups/videoexperience (digital-/interactive-/video-art)
vimeo.com/groups/01fx (animation/motion graphics/compositing)

group.name: Alpha-ville
group.description:
This group is aimed at creatives,         digital art practitioners,         professionals and people interested in the digital culture. We aim to explore and promote ideas,         concepts and find inspiration for our yearly festival.

Thanks for submitting your video.

group.name: The Story Beyond The Still
group.description:
It was the first ever and largest user-generated HD video contest in history,         where photographers became filmmakers and we all saw beyond the still. Month after month,         aspiring filmmakers were invited to pick up where the previous winning short film ended – on an evocative photograph. Contestants then reinterpreted that still,         telling the story that lived beyond it in a short film of their own. Then,         after the final chapter was created by Vincent Laforet and all the chapter winners,         the collective film premiered at the Sundance Film Festival.
And now the collective film will premiere on the Sundance Channel. February 7th at 7:45pm est. Check it out!

group.name: Light Graffiti
group.description:
This group is dedicated to the amazing art of drawing with light.

Light painting,         also known as light drawing or light graffiti,         is a photographic technique in which exposures are made usually at night or in a darkened room by moving a hand-held light source or by moving the camera

Play with your camera exposure and shutter settings and use a lot of imagination!!!
:-O

group.name: Brooklyn Bowl :: Eye Candy For Strangers
group.description:
Brooklyn Bowl,         Learned Evolution and Vimeo are calling all video artists to submit motion graphic art,         animation,         short films,         music videos,         and VJ visuals of ten minutes or less,         via the Eye Candy For Strangers Vimeo Group.

The selected video will also run regularly at future Brooklyn Bowl events!

Don't know Brooklyn Bowl?  This should help: 

http://vimeo.com/18333508

Past selections:

http://vimeo.com/album/216608

**Submission rules are in the Forum section of this group.

group.name: 1 Minute: a Vimeo Project
group.description:
Welcome to the 1 Minute Vimeo Project Group.  Add one video,         comment on two!

With the chaos of everyday life consuming our senses,         it is nice to sit back and enjoy moments and experiences that are often overlooked. This project aims to study the forgotten moments and times in life that we often pass by without acknowledging.

The rules:
-Video must be exactly one minute long
-No camera movement (no panning,         tilting,         etc)
-No editing whatsoever
-Use original sound
-Tag with '1 minute'
-Have fun

group.name: MAGIX Video Contest 2009
group.description:
Participate in MAGIX's video editing contest,         beat all others and win a two-week dream vacation for two to Hollywood. In addition,         fantastic other prizes await 2nd through 5th place winners. 

The only condition: You must edit your video with MAGIX Movie Edit Pro and add the MAGIX logo at the start. Your video shouldn't be longer than 5 minutes. Join this group and add your video!

Contest Rules: http://vimeo.com/groups/magixcontest/forumthread:8648

Contest Prizes: http://vimeo.com/groups/magixcontest/forumthread:8720

For further information please check out: www.magix.com/videocontest

group.name: MetaGroup
group.description:
This group brings together the creators and moderators of the most subscribed groups/channels on Vimeo (>500 subscribers),         to exchange ideas and opinions,         discuss general issues concerning Vimeo and possibly plan and promote collective projects. It's meant to be a small but fine,         independent and critical platform for discussing and networking among people who contributed to making Vimeo the interesting place it is today.

So keep an eye on the forums section!

group.name: The Pictures Don't Move
group.description:
This group is for films without big editing and camera movement. Everyone is invited to add films that fit these simple rules:

1. No camera movement (zoom,         pan,         ...)!
2. No editing (cut,         time manipulation,         ...)!
3. No performance (acting,         dancing,         ...)!
4. Original sound (no music,         ...)!
5. At least 30sec long!
